data.title: OBSERVATIONS
questions: In this phase, recall what happened and how you reacted.
What did you see and hear? What happened exactly?,
What specific things did people say and do?
What other details do you recall? What was unusual about it?
What tone of voice? What body language? What energy level?
How did your body respond? Where was any stress localized?
What did you say and/or do at the time?,
How did others respond? The same or different from you?

data.title: INTUITIONS
questions: In this phase, explore other explanations about that happened.
What was the 'mood'? What does your gut/intuition tell you?
What do you infer from what happened? What’s really going on?
What do you infer from what happened? What’s really going on?
Reading between the lines…what does it all mean?
What could come of it? Where is it likely headed?

data.title: REACTIONS
questions: In this phase, evaluate the personal and interpersonal impacts of what happened.
To what extent did you dislike/disagree with what happened?
What emotions have you experienced? How are you feeling now?
What’s something or someone about the situation that you can affirm?
To what extent did this impact one of your values? Which value(s)?
What seems to be the value(s) of the group at odds with your own?
To what extent was what happened inappropriate? Unethical? Immoral? Illegal?
How is this affecting your trust in the people involved? Their trust in you?
What's the likely impact of this on your relationship with the people involved?
How do you stay true to your values and beliefs in responding?

data.title: CONCLUSIONS
questions: In this phase, summarize your insights and conclusions, and decide what to do.
What's their main point/conclusion? What's their logic?
What assumptions are being made? What are the pros/cons?
What consequences do you see with their approach?
How significant are those consequences? Are you sure?
To what extent is your knowledge/competence being questioned?
What's not being said? What's making it 'undiscussable'?
In way might you respond without compromising your principles/ethics?
What’s the risk/downside of confronting the group?
What’s the risk of NOT saying or doing anything?
What will you say? What will you do?
